answers.answer: Essential emergency contacts include the Iași County Immigration Service, the emergency call number 112, and the National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The website provides information on managing in Iași, and various organizations listed under 'Organisations offering their support' can assist new residents with different aspects of daily life.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: A support program for accommodation, meals, and integration is managed by the Directorate of Social Assistance Iași. Additionally, the CTR Nicolina Refugee Center offers accommodation and food.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Iași' and 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Public transport in Iași is not free for Ukrainians, but new residents can find details about ticket costs, payment methods, and public transport areas via a provided link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: For urgent medical services, adults can contact the County Emergency Clinical Hospital ,,Sf. Spiridon" Iași, and for children, the Emergency Clinical Hospital for Children ,,Sf. Maria" Iași.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Psychological support is provided by the International Organization for Migration (IOM), Project HOPE, Asociatia ParentIS, World Vision Romania, Save the Children, and Red Cross Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Educational opportunities include kindergarten, school preparation, Ukrainian language school for grades 1-11, and integration programs at the multi-service center. Various organizations also offer educational activities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the sections under 'Education' and 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Adults can access free Romanian language courses at Inspectoratul Școlar Județean Iași, Centrul de Asistență Umanitară și Socială pentru Refugiați CTR Nicolina, Crucea Roșie, and Caritas.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Legal advice for new residents is offered by CNRR (Romanian National Council for Refugees), AIDRom, and Justiție pentru minori.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Support organizations provide a wide range of assistance including accommodation, food, medical aid, psychological counseling, legal advice, language courses, educational activities, and support for integration and specific services like translation reimbursements.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Someone can find specific service providers near their location by exploring the map available on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Women needing reproductive health services can find support for contraception, breastfeeding, prevention of STDs, pregnancy monitoring, and abortion through the Women's Center.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: Support for victims of domestic violence is offered through services dedicated to them, accessible via the Women's Center section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: Assistance for accessing medical services and medicines is available from the ICAR Foundation. AIDRom and Justiție pentru minori also offer support for accessing medical services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: New residents can receive support for job searching through career guidance sessions offered by Alternative Sociale.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Services for families with children include urgent medical care, kindergarten, school preparation, Ukrainian language school, and other educational activities. Additionally, accommodation, meals for mothers and children, and socio-cultural activities are available.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the sections under 'Medical services', 'Education', and 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Information crucial for understanding one's legal status includes details on the asylum procedure, child protection, and integration, which can be obtained through legal advice from organizations like CNRR.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.
